(Sorry about that. DarkMouse never was one to have that much respect 
for authority. LMAO)

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> Bounty checked his translator, either it was malfunctioning or he'd 
> just been insulted. "Insulting an officer of the law? punishable by 
> death." He had his first target located, they now had 5 hours and 
50 
> minutes to respond to his direct order.
> 
> (I'll wait and see if anyone else gets in on the slaughter before 
> posting with him again.)
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> > DarkMouse::
> > 
> > She heard the transmission. She sighed and opened her link. She 
was 
> > getting bored and had nothing better to do. She listened and 
> > laughed. "Get a load of this guy. He thinks he can actually go 
> around 
> > and make us surrender just by threats?" She laughed. "Oh I got to 
> > reply to this one."  She turned on her link, but sent the signal 
> > through the atmosphere to block it's origins. She then replied to 
> > this bot. She stuck out her tongue at her link,"FFFBBBBRRRRTTTTT" 
> > Then disconnected the transmission. She fell on the floor 
laughing.
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > > Bounty opened a channel on all frequencies, "I am a security 
> > officer 
> > > of the temporal sciences law enforcement agency. All beings not 
> of 
> > > this world are ordered to report to my ship to unconditionally 
> > > surrender or Be hunted down like the animals you transform 
into, 
> > You 
> > > have six hours to comply or I will do this the hard way. He 
> paused 
> > > hoping for a quick response, "I do hope you prefer the hard 
way." 
> > he 
> > > landed by his ship and waited for the flocks of bots to return 
> and 
> > > surrender.
> > >
